conversion_verification.notes: The 3D render clearly shows walls with height and thickness, a perceptible interior volume, and an angled view with the roof removed.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Walls have good height and thickness. Floors are separate. Interior volume is clear. Corner geometry is mostly good, but some parts are a bit boxy. The viewing angle is appropriate and the interior is visible. The roof is cleanly removed, but there are some slight issues with the cleanliness of the geometry in a few spots, such as around the deck areas.

geometric_accuracy.notes: The room configuration is largely correct, with appropriate adjacencies and proportions, though some rooms have slightly distorted shapes. Major wall positions align well. Internal partitions are mostly correctly placed. However, many windows are missing, and some doors are either missing or not clearly defined as openings. The sizes of the openings where present are somewhat generic.

interior_elements.notes: Most major furniture items (beds, sofas, dining table) are present and in the correct rooms. Kitchen and bathroom fixtures are present. However, the details of the furniture are very simplified, and in some cases, the scale and orientation could be better matched to the 2D plan, e.g., the sofas in the living room and the beds in various bedrooms don't perfectly align with their 2D counterparts.

visual_clarity.notes: Structural elements are clearly distinguishable. The geometry is readable, though some texture information from the 2D is lost. Interior visibility is good, and lighting doesn't obscure details. Material usage is consistent. There are some minor issues with rendering fidelity, such as the generic gray texture for most walls. The background is clean but text labels from the 2D plan are present in the 3D render.

detected_errors.description: Many windows are missing from the 3D render. Some doors are not clearly defined as openings.
Furniture is simplified and in some cases, scale and orientation are not perfectly matched to the 2D plan.
Text labels from the 2D plan are present in the 3D render, detracting from the visual clarity.

summary: The 3D conversion successfully transformed the 2D plan into an isometric 3D model with good structural clarity and general geometric accuracy, though it has several inaccuracies in window placement, door definition, and furniture detail, and contains text from the 2D plan.
